Hi Nathan, 

A p2p REST style, and consequently a p2p Web, is definitely no=
t rambling -- what it *is* is the focus of my ph.d. research :). Having a p=
2p network on the HTTP level would not only solve a lot of existing communi=
cation problems of the Web, but also increase the number application-level =
functionalities exposed on the Web. Think of all the functionalities that a=
re "trapped" on the client side, disconnected from the Web, although they o=
riginated from the Web by the means of navigating to a Web application.

I =
should shut up before someone publishes these ideas in a paper before I do.=
 :)

+ If you already haven't, you should check out Justin Erenkrantz's dis=
sertation on CREST - http://www.erenkrantz.com/CREST/ which is an "evolutio=
n" of REST founded on *very* similar ideas. Guess who Justin's advisor was.=
.. :)

Ivan
